basics.name: Olaoluwa Akanji
basics.label: Computer Science Student
basics.summary: Detail-oriented and versatile Computer Science major with practical experience in infrastructure asset management, product ownership, data analytics, and full-stack web development. Proficient in Power BI, SQL, Oracle, Jira, Python, Java, and more.

honors: Brock Entrance Academic Excellence Scholarship Award (2020)

work.position: Data Management and Analytics Coop Associate
work.summary: Supported infrastructure asset management, developed dashboards in Power BI, conducted data validation, and contributed to policy and cybersecurity efforts.
highlights: Developed Power BI dashboards and visualizations.
Validated data using Power BI, Excel, SQL, Oracle.
Created visual materials with Canva, PowToon, Camtasia.
Worked with ArcGIS and other ministry-specific datasets.
Wrote M and DAX queries for data manipulation.
Assisted in cost-risk estimating for funding requests.
Implemented MFA and classified data with Microsoft ADP.
Conducted strategic research to support decisions.

work.summary: Provided technical support, web development, and server-side administration while contributing to team-based Laravel projects.
highlights: Resolved tickets, phone monitoring, and email support.
Handled web hosting services and customer inquiries.
Worked with Laravel, Docker, WebPal, Filament.
Reported project progress regularly to supervisors.
Researched and developed independent tech projects.
Executed server-side queries and DNS lookups.

activities.organization: Junior Engineers, Technicians and Scientists Club
activities.summary: Coordinated club events, scheduled meetings, and boosted participation through competitions.
